an5.169:1.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.
an5.169:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to him:
an5.169:2.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, how are we to define a mendicant who is quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings, who learns well, learns much, and does not forget what they’ve learned?”
an5.169:2.3: Why don’t you clarify this yourself?”
an5.169:2.4: “Well then, Reverend Sāriputta, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an5.169:3.1: “It’s when a mendicant is skilled in the meaning, skilled in the teaching, skilled in terminology, skilled in phrasing, and skilled in sequence.
an5.169:3.2: That is how to define a mendicant who is quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings, who learns well, learns much, and does not forget what they’ve learned.”
an5.169:3.4: How well this was said by Venerable Ānanda!
an5.169:3.5: And we will remember Venerable Ānanda as someone who has these five qualities:
an5.169:3.6: ‘Reverend Ānanda is skilled in the meaning, skilled in the teaching, skilled in terminology, skilled in phrasing, and skilled in sequence.’”
